__e: No, Dad, you said that we could go to get pancakes and now I've been here for an hour and a half.
You promised me that we could go to get pancakes and then you kept making me wait.
Went out to the lighthouse and back and then we made pancakes and we sat by the fire and read... that afternoon?
You're the nice lady who bought her the pancake breakfast.
Why don't I take you all for some pancakes to carb-load for the big day?
But I always get pancakes on my birthday.
Hmm. But I like the butt-shaped pancakes.
Yeah, but we could get heart-shaped pancakes.
Yeah, but we could get heart-shaped pancakes.
Mom already made you pancakes for breakfast.
I want to make pancakes with the mixings I decide.
I would much, much rather be having pancakes with you, but my family needs me! It's sort of a crisis.
So when it's 2:00 a.m., and your son won't stop crying because he wants his daddy, it's because you'll be out having pancakes with these people?
